Pre-Game Insights: Die Mannschaft to take on Greece in a friendly before their Euro 2024 opener against Scotland.
Nagelsmann might have taken positives from his side’s dominant showing but they ultimately lacked a cutting edge in the final third.
Greece are gearing up for their first fixture since March when they were eliminated from Euro 2024 qualifying.
The Greek team has never beaten Germany but now they will have the chance to beat them.
Antonio Rüdiger and Toni Kroos, who were absent due to UEFA Champions League finals fatigue, will be available for this match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kick-Off: Friday, 7 June 2024 at 06:45 PM (GMT), 02:15 PM (EST)
The home team have 1.29 odds in favour of them to win the match, 5.50 odds in favour of the match ending in a draw and 9.25 odds in favour of Greece to win the fixture.
German team don’t have any injury concerns going into this game.
Away team also don’t have any injury issues and all players are fit to play in the upcoming match.
Others: Florian Wirtz is a technically gifted player, aiding progression by receiving between the opposition’s defensive and midfield lines.
Georgios Masouras is one of the most lethal and dangerous players in the Greece national team, known for his technical skills and high game intelligence.
The predicted lineup for Germany includes Neuer (GK), Kimmich, Tah, Rudiger, Mittelstadt, Kroos, Andrich, Musiala, Gundogan, Wirtz, and Havertz.
The predicted lineup for Greece includes Vlachodimos (GK), Saliakas, Chatzidiakos, Mavropanos, Giannoulis, Bakesetas, Kourbelis, Mantalos, Masouras, Ioannidis, and Tzolis.
